Es Portal

[h1]HipnÃ³tico[/h1]
Uno de mis juegos favoritos. La sensaciÃ³n de abrir portales y ver que es lo que ocurre me tiene todavÃ­a hipnotizado despuÃ©s de tantos aÃ±os. 

Para los que hayan vivido en otro planeta en estos aÃ±os y no sepa de quÃ© va os explico que Portal es un juego de resoluciÃ³n de puzles a partir de interactuar con el entorno mediante portales. El juego tiene una visiÃ³n en primera persona y tu personaje es una chica metida en una especie de experimento a lo pelicula CUBE.

La Ãºnica pega es que se hace muy corto y que no tiene funciones online (subsanado en Portal 2 con un buen cooperativo)
Recomendadisima la compra y recomiendo jugarlo antes de Portal 2 para ver la transformaciÃ³n del entorno.

Nota: [b]9.5/10[/b]

THERE IS AN AI HELL

The cake may be a lie, but I can't lie - this is an excellent game! I personally am not fond of first-person shooters, due to games like Doom and Half-Life, among other M-rated titles. However, this is a puzzle game where you don't shoot demons or aliens with bullets and see gore; you're shooting portals at walls, ceilings, and floors, and robots are the things that "die".

This game is rated T, and only because of the blood splatters. The way the character dies is surprisingly non-violent: You are looking from the floor, and anything you are holding skid away from you on the floor. Then you press a key (or button), and it brings you back to the last save point. Simple as that!

If you've played Half-Life, this is a good compliment to the series. If not, it does good on its own.

If you're just going for story completion, it's a very short game. My time played is how long it took me to beat this, it's fairly easy. To be completely honest, I probably didnt do 1 or 2 tests in the way they should've been done because of how easy it is to cheese some of them. Overall, its a great game, but very short. There are more bonus chambers and challenges but that may not be your thing. If you're looking to kill some time and work your brain, pick it up and play it if you haven't already.

I'd never played Portal before, only the second game. I picked up the first one in a "complete my bundle" for the Portal games and I've really enjoyed it. Some of the puzzles were surprisingly difficult. My only gripe is that the macOS version is very outdated and wouldn't go beyond the 1280x800 resolution (my Macbook Pro has a 2560x1600 display). The macOS Mojave beta also warned me that the game wouldn't run sometime in the future as the application is 32-bit (which macOS will soon be dropping support for).

I like this game, just as the first one, but there are somethings that I donâ€™t like, like it's very simple (compared to Portal 2), and achievements are pretty simple, too.
But the Soundtrack and Good graphics (being a game from 2007 (On high Settings)), the history, and the price are pretty good, really recommend buying, but you should buy the Portal pack with the 2 releases, because I prefer the second game because of difficulty, and the coop, but the histories of the games are a little bit â€œconnectâ€ between each other.
Also I recommend getting the achievements of this game, because they're very challenging.

Muy buen juego. Los grÃ¡ficos y el arte son hermosos. El juego consiste en utilizar portales para superar una serie de puzzles. La historia es entretenida, corta y atrapante. Muy buena jugabilidad, pasÃ© como 2 horas probando efectos con los portales. El tiempo estimado de juego es de 2 horas, y no me parece muy re-jugable, serÃ¡ decisiÃ³n personal el si vale o no la pena adquirilo por el precio completo.

I would pay to have my memory of this wiped so I could play it again, and again, and have the same experience again as I did the first time.

One of the best games ever made, period. The only game of a similar kind that beats it is Portal 2. The Portal series is one of those games you just have to play, and if you don't you're missing out. A lot.

I was on the steam store when I saw this game on sale. I had been looking at it for some time so I decided to buy it. It did not let me down. It was fun and enjoyable and had good controls. I personally have played and finished this game at least 3 times. Overall it is a good game and I have no regrets about buying it.

Takes time and your brain to play this game, really cool and funky.
